articles.title: Covid-19 pandemic leads to 80% drop in routine cancer screening, limits research - The Indian Express
articles.description: COVID-19 has left a negative impact on cancer care, disrupting the diagnosis and treatment in most of the patients in India.
articles.content: The coronaviruspandemic and the subsequent lockdowns have impacted not only cancer care but also the research in the field. The uncertainty has introduced new risks for cancer patients, disrupting th… [+5540 chars]

articles.title: While we still can - Millennium Post
articles.description: Caution has to supersede panic, and preparation over profligacy if we are to identify and address...
articles.content: Recently, India joined the league of nations that has decided to vaccinate children below the age of 18 years. Several countries including the UK, the USA, Canada, France, Germany, Japan, Norway and … [+13082 chars]

articles.author: Miriam E. Tucker
articles.title: 'Staggering' Doubling of Type 2 Diabetes in Kids During Pandemic - Medscape
articles.description: Two new studies show a shocking increase in type 2 diabetes among kids in the US during the pandemic, with increased severity at presentation. Black children were disproportionately affected.
articles.content: The incidence of type 2 diabetes in children appears to have doubled during the COVID-19 pandemic, data from two new US studies suggest, with the lead investigator of one saying she was "surprised by… [+7399 chars]

articles.author: ET HealthWorld
articles.title: Signs of brain inflammation found in people who died of Covid-19: Study - ETHealthworld.com
articles.description: The findings by researchers at the Stanford School of Medicine, US, and Saarland University in Germany may help explain why many Covid-19 patients report neurological problems.
articles.content: Scientists have found signs of inflammation and neurodegeneration in the brains of individuals who died of Covid-19, similar to what is observed in people who die of conditions such as Alzheimer's an… [+3123 chars]
